content: Please does anyone have any experience with an open-source video editor for use with Windows? I would appreciate any recommendation. I don't need anything too advanced/complicated. Thanks for any help you can give.
What features are you after @Graham Oliver ? ...doesn't Windows Movie Maker cut it?
...there's a few notable free and/or open-source ones like https://www.videolan.org/vlmc, https://shotcut.org, https://www.olivevideoeditor.org, and https://www.openshot.org

@klonos I have two particular difficulties with Windows Movie Maker (a) precise placing of trim position - cannot use keyboard for precise adjustment of time, and (b) cannot use other than white color for basic text.
Thanks for the four suggestions; maybe I will have to try them in turn until I find one that suits me.

Have you tried Blackmagic's DaVinci Resolve, there is a free version available.

https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/uk/products/davinciresolve/edit

Scroll to the bottom for the download link.
